intro: Crotalaria agatiflora subsp. agatiflora, commonly known as the scarlet crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its typical legume structure and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features palmately compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers in racemes. Its fruit is a pod that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and grasslands. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
